alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 2:11PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Teton County through 245 PM MDT... At 211 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Entrance, or 7 miles south of West Yellowstone, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Fairy Falls, Firehole Canyon, Harlequin Lake, Fountain Paint Pot and Mystic Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
